intro: Microlicia donii, commonly known as the white sand orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Microlicia donii has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
